summary: A letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys (Cohen & Gresser LLP) to Judge Alison J. Nathan, stating they have no edits to the court's proposed limiting instructions but request an opportunity to respond to the government's submission. This is a procedural filing in the criminal case against Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The client of Cohen & Gresser LLP, who is the defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom the letter is addressed.

connections.description: Cohen & Gresser LLP is representing Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal case, as stated in the letter.

events.title: Court Order on Limiting Instructions
events.description: The Court issued an order requesting parties to submit suggested edits to proposed limiting instructions.

events.title: Final Pretrial Conference
events.description: Scheduled final pretrial conference in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: United States Courthouse, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, Cohen & Gresser LLP, submitted this letter to Judge Nathan.
The defense stated they had no edits to the court's proposed limiting instructions.
The defense requested an opportunity to respond to the government's submission, either in writing or at the upcoming pretrial conference.
This document is part of the procedural record for case S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.
The letter indicates ongoing pretrial preparations and legal maneuvering in late 2021.
